metadata.title: USN-6465-2 -- Linux kernel (Raspberry Pi) vulnerabilities
metadata.description: Yu Hao and Weiteng Chen discovered that the Bluetooth HCI UART driver in the Linux kernel contained a race condition, leading to a null pointer dereference vulnerability. A local attacker could use this to cause a denial of service (system crash). (CVE-2023-31083)  Lin Ma discovered that the Netlink Transformation (XFRM) subsystem in the Linux kernel contained a null pointer dereference vulnerability in some situations. A local privileged attacker could use this to cause a denial of service (system crash). (CVE-2023-3772)  Update Instructions:  Run `sudo pro fix USN-6465-2` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected by updating your system to the following package versions:  linux-buildinfo-5.15.0-1042-raspi - 5.15.0-1042.45 linux-modules-5.15.0-1042-raspi - 5.15.0-1042.45 linux-modules-extra-5.15.0-1042-raspi - 5.15.0-1042.45 linux-raspi-headers-5.15.0-1042 - 5.15.0-1042.45 linux-image-5.15.0-1042-raspi - 5.15.0-1042.45 linux-headers-5.15.0-1042-raspi - 5.15.0-1042.45 linux-tools-5.15.0-1042-raspi - 5.15.0-1042.45 linux-raspi-tools-5.15.0-1042 - 5.15.0-1042.45 No subscription required  linux-image-raspi-nolpae - 5.15.0.1042.40 linux-modules-extra-raspi - 5.15.0.1042.40 linux-raspi - 5.15.0.1042.40 linux-modules-extra-raspi-nolpae - 5.15.0.1042.40 linux-headers-raspi - 5.15.0.1042.40 linux-tools-raspi-nolpae - 5.15.0.1042.40 linux-tools-raspi - 5.15.0.1042.40 linux-headers-raspi-nolpae - 5.15.0.1042.40 linux-image-raspi - 5.15.0.1042.40 linux-raspi-nolpae - 5.15.0.1042.40 No subscription required
